results.title: Newsfront [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Richard Brennan, David Elfick and Palm Beach Pictures
results.brief_description: This is the dramatic story of the newsreel cameramen who lived and worked in Australia during the golden era of the newsreel from 1948 to 1956. Len Maguire is a top cameraman whose devotion to his work and loyalty to his company creates conflict with both his colleagues and the people he loves. Amy is a production assistant working in a predominantly male environment and Len’s brother, Frank, heads the Australian branch of an American newsreel company in competition with Len’s company.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Noyce, Richard Brennan, David Elfick and Palm Beach Pictures

results.title: Looking for Alibrandi [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Kate Woods, Robyn Kershaw, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Premium Movie Partnership and AFFC
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by first time writer Melina Marchetta, “Looking for Alibrandi” is an affectionate look at three generations of strong willed Italian women, and the youngest member, Josie’s (Pia Miranda) attempt to break the family “curse”. 17 year old Josie lives with her single mother Christina (Greta Scacchi), is completing her HSC at an exclusive Sydney school on a scholarship, begrudgingly visiting her Nonna, defending the labels of “wog” and “bastard”, and longing after the lifestyle afforded to rich kids with both parents. When her father, Michael (Anthony La Paglia) enters their lives again, Josie confronts her mother and her Nonna about the rift between Christina and her father, and the animosity between mother and daughter to reveal secrets long since hidden. Josie must also make decisions about her future career and what her heart desires as she is torn between school captain John Barton (Matthew Newton) and public school boy Jacob (Kick Gurry). Between work, school, family and personal relationships, Josie discovers that life is filled with uncertainty and she is not the only one debilitated by the labels society ascribes. This was the first feature film effort for both director Woods and actor Miranda. Remarkably, the film was nominated and won several AFI awards, including best film, best supporting actress (Scacchi) and best performance by an actress in a leading role (Miranda).

results.title: Two hands [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Gregor Jordan, Marian MacGowan, Meridian Films and CML
results.brief_description: Set in Sydney’s King’s Cross, 19 year old Jimmy (Heath Ledger) finds himself in debt to a local gangster, Pando, played by perennial Australian actor Bryan Brown, when a simple job goes wrong. Jimmy’s life depends on his locating the $10,000 he has lost. As his scheme to replace the cash is played out, two street kids are enjoying a shopping spree with the original loot. The black humour of the film progressively darkens as the story unfolds. Rose Byrne co-stars as country girl, Alex, who becomes involved with Jimmy and his increasingly dire situation.

results.title: Lore of the land (PC & MAC)
results.creator_credit: Adele Howard, Multimedia 21 Fund - Cinemedia and Fraynework Multimedia
results.brief_description: The land we live in shapes our lives and holds the story of our relationship with its vast mystery. This CD ROM is an invitation to explore and understand the Aboriginal love of the land. Take a journey through new cultural insights, Australian landscapes and Indigenous voices. It is designed to encourage us to live in harmony with each other and with the land we call home. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Power Macintosh system 7.6.6 or later, 32MB RAM, 40 MB free HD space, 640 X 480 display (set to thousands of colours), 4 X CD ROM or better. IBM PC and Compatible: Pentium 200 or better, Windows 95 or later, 32MB RAM, 40MB free HD space, 640 X 480 SVGA display set to 16-bit colour (thousands), 4 X CD ROM. To run the videos on this CD ROM, you will need to instal Apple Quicktime Version 4 on your computer (contained on CD ROM).

results.title: The Face of North Sydney (PC)
results.brief_description: This disc contains over 3,700 photographs, the full text of “Naming North Sydney” (an historical dictionary of place names) and the full text of 24 heritage leaflets. It has been produced by North Sydney Council’s Stanton Library. The Local Studies Collection, from which the photographs are taken is located within the library (234 Miller Street, North Sydney).

results.title: Learning Walmajarri (PC & MAC) (A)
results.creator_credit: Catholic Education Office of Western Australia
results.brief_description: SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: PC; Multimedia capable Pentium running Windows 95.16 megabytes RAM, (32 megabytes RAM recommended). Monitor 640 x 480 resolution, 16 bit colour (thousands of colours), 8X CD drive or faster. External speakers or headphones. MAC; 68040 (30Mhz) or better (Power PC recommended) running Mac 0S 7.5 or later. Minimum of 8 megabytes FREE application RAM. DO NOT USE VIRTUAL MEMORY. Monitor 640 x 480 resolution, 16 bit colour (thousands of colours). 8X CD drive or faster. Optional external speakers or headphones. Jointly funded by the Catholic Education Office in the Kimberley region and two schools - Kururrungku Catholic Education Centre and John Pujajangka Plyrin Catholic School, ‘Learning Walmajarri’ is the result of digitising elements of the program taught by tribal elders in the Walmajarri-speaking areas around Broome. “The multimedia format of a CD is well suited to the oral tradition, which is the context in which the elders teach their language, using songs and stories to impart vocabulary and syntax”(‘The Australian’ Tuesday June 8 199 pg. 20). Designed to assist in improving literacy amongst Walmajarri speakers, this program uses jigsaws and traditional stories and songs as entertaining instruction, although people who have no previous experience with Walmajarri may be tempted to give it a try.

results.title: Discovery : Explore the world of oil & gas (MAC & PC)
results.brief_description: Take a first hand look at the oil and gas industry in Australia. You can visit areas such as; offshore production platforms, onshore gas and oil fields, witness the end use of gas and oil products, oil and gas reserves, processing products at the refinery, see how natural gas is created and trapped in the earth, and visit AMOSC (Australian Oil Spill Centre). There’s an historical overview, safety outline, and a chance to do some testing.

results.title: A Collection of interactive work created by students (MAC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “RMIT Collection”.
Interactive works of the Graduate Diploma Students of Animation and Interactive Media at RMIT. The titles included are: ‘Haiku Dada’ - Felix Hude; ‘Arlecchino’ - Rosanna Morales; ‘Autograph’ - Mark Lycette; ‘Totally Rediculuos’ - Greg Zaritski; ‘Travels with cod’ - Gwyn Wethereld; ‘The Swear Club’ - Michael Buckley; ‘Equinox’ - Paul Western-Pittard.

results.title: Three Mile Creek (MAC)
results.creator_credit: Alyssa Rothwell and Department of Visual Communication, RMIT
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “RMIT Collection”.
This CD ROM is a collection of anecdotal accounts inspired by the experience of growing up in rural Australia. Music, dialogue and soundscape evoke the richness of the environment and create a sense of being there. A contemplative approach is the key to enjoying the stories. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Recommended for use on a Power MacIntosh with a minimum of 15MB free RAM.

results.title: Tales from the kangaroo's crypt (MAC & PC)
results.creator_credit: National Museum of Australia, University of New South Wales, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, The Riversleigh Society and Energee Entertainment
results.brief_description: This interactive CD-ROM takes you on a time-travelling mystery tour of the Australian fossil record from The PreCambrian Era 3500 million years ago, to the future in 2200 AD. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS:MacIntosh: System 7, PC: Windows 3.1 or 95, optimised for 4X CD players.
